text:
I'm trying to update a package that last worked on Julia v0.5. This is a weird experience.
<https://github.com/bhoeckendorf/KLB.jl>

elements.text: I'm trying to update a package that last worked on Julia v0.5. This is a weird experience.

text: yeah don't try to warp speed it

elements.text: yeah don't try to warp speed it

text: I found it easiest to try the code first on v0.6, fix the depwards, then v0.7, fix the depwarns, then 1.0

elements.text: I found it easiest to try the code first on v0.6, fix the depwards, then v0.7, fix the depwarns, then 1.0

text: Ah, just looked at the code. Doesn't look too bad.

elements.text: Ah, just looked at the code. Doesn't look too bad.

text: it surprises me that there is not much to change from the earliest packages written in the earliest versions of julia to the latest version of julia. this means that the language design were designed very well from the beginning. the language syntax is quiet stable from its first release. most of the issues were changes in the Dictionary syntax and deprecations.

elements.text: it surprises me that there is not much to change from the earliest packages written in the earliest versions of julia to the latest version of julia. this means that the language design were designed very well from the beginning. the language syntax is quiet stable from its first release. most of the issues were changes in the Dictionary syntax and deprecations.
